required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating Local Susceptibility Patterns Associated With Tigecycline in Comparison to Other Antibiotics
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Antimicrobial Activity In Vitro of Tigecycline in Comparison to Other Broad Spectrum Antibiotics in Isolates Collected From Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: Various bacterial organisms will be tested in order to compile information regarding the effectiveness of tigecycline against certain bacteria seen in local communities.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, microbiologic in vitro evaluation which will study the susceptibility of tigecycline in disk diffusion on clinical bacterial isolates collected from inpatients and outpatients. Fourteen hospital centers participated in the program. In vitro efficacy of tigecycline will be determined through the in vitro disk diffusion activity, using FDA breakpoints.

arm_group.description: A listing of all isolates meeting the inclusion criteria will be maintained.

criteria.textblock: Inclusion Criteria: Any protocol-specified microorganism isolated from the samples collected from hospitalized patients and outpatients

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

responsible_party.name_title: Wyeth (Registry Contact: Clinical Trial Registry Specialist)
